pullRequest.body:
I needed this to transfer the monoidal structure from `ModuleCat` to `QuadraticModuleCat`, but would also work for transferring the same structure from `ModuleCat` to `AlgebraCat`.

The changes are:

* A new `CategoryTheory.Monoidal.induced` definition, proven from scratch with slightly uglier proofs than what `transport` used. The new proofs use `simp` rather more than targeted slice commands, mainly due to lack of patience on my part.
* `CategoryTheory.Monoidal.transport` now has a trivial implementation in terms of `induced`, as does `CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategory.fullMonoidalSubcategory` (though this was already fairly trivial)
* `CategoryTheory.Monoidal.laxToTransported` has been removed, as it's just a less useful version of `CategoryTheory.Monoidal.toTransported`
* `CategoryTheory.Monoidal.toTransported` has been golfed to oblivion, as it now falls out trivially by showing `fromTransported` first.

---

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b570e6bd-001b-413c-8e47-bca0c3ecea86) for commit 5748be8e7cff496ef4893cb14d9c28faa28a99ee.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/6bce3eed-84ea-484f-85c5-298414615477/to/b570e6bd-001b-413c-8e47-bca0c3ecea86) against commit e70f8800f70f89b102ad7469128ace674213e1e5:
```diff
  Benchmark                                      Metric         Change
  ====================================================================
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Subcategory   instructions   157.3%
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Transport     instructions    93.3%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e358ff18-f497-44bf-8483-38f81e430014) for commit 21c696b30ee32e8a3336488147b9c46c3d6b3dae.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a9461331-5179-4635-a75e-e4e82aa523bd) for commit edb0268b72e06a5632d2177002e12bb3f0b511f3.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4309e88b-935c-46f5-93bc-ec614c7cd043) for commit 2fec58def24e64b8f5026bb0b05b56a4f665c95f.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/6bce3eed-84ea-484f-85c5-298414615477/to/4309e88b-935c-46f5-93bc-ec614c7cd043) against commit e70f8800f70f89b102ad7469128ace674213e1e5:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================================
- lint                                                                wall-clock       5.4%
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.FilteredColimitCommutesFiniteLimit   instructions     6.1%
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Subcategory                        instructions   107.3%
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Transport                          instructions    23.5%
```
Oh, that's not so bad after all

> This construction shall certainly have other applications in the future.)

An obvious one is that this should give us the monoidal structure of `AlgebraCat` for not much work; I've updated the description.

Thanks!

  [gh]: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/configuring-branches-and-merges-in-your-repository/configuring-pull-request-merges/managing-a-merge-queue



  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6460497617/job/17538293880)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6460497617/job/17538293457)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6460497617/job/17538293655)

I would think the code would look nicer if the parameters of `induced` were part of a structure named something like `CoreInducedMonoidalCategory`. Otherwise, it is great! (This construction shall certainly have other applications in the future.)

I tried this [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/eric-wieser/Monoidal.induced...eric-wieser/Monoidal.induced-structure), but it seems to cause reducibility problems that break `aesop_cat` and force some nasty `erw`s.

I have some other ideas for cleaning this up (such as moving the operators of `MonoidalCategory` into a data-only typeclass, #7279), but they're bigger refactors (starting with #7277 which it turns out interferes with another in-progres refactor) that I'd rather not make at the same time as this.

Are you happy with the structure-free approach for now?

The need of `erw` is a quite common general issue with full subcategories, because `Hom` types are defeq accross different categories. I would very much prioritize the use of a structure, even if there are a few proofs which require a trivial fix.
I was able to get aesop to work by adding two local simp lemmas.

I expect the structure version to cause quite a large performance regression in `RepresentationTheory`; I'd prefer to merge the version with the individual fields, and leave the structure refactor until after the `MonoidalCategory` refactor in #6307 concludes, as otherwise I worry that I'm just going to trap that refactor in timeouts.

I've started another benchmark to see just how much worse things are...

```suggestion
  induced e.inverse
```

```suggestion
  Monoidal.induced (fullSubcategoryInclusion P)
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion f ≫ g = (f ≫ g : X.obj ⟶ Z.obj) := rfl ```
